dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, get this. There's a new report out, and it's suggesting something pretty wild for the Caspian Sea.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, get this. There's a new report out, and it's suggesting something pretty wild for the Caspian Sea.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Spill. What's happening in the Caspian now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Spill. What's happening in the Caspian now?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, apparently, Azerbaijan is considering allowing gambling – like, full-blown casinos – on artificial islands they might create in the water.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, apparently, Azerbaijan is considering allowing gambling - like, full-blown casinos - on artificial islands they might create in the water.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A new proposal in Azerbaijan could allow gambling"such as casinos"on artificial territories created in the waters of the Caspian.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Artificial islands just for gambling? That sounds... ambitious. And, uh, isn't gambling totally illegal in Azerbaijan right now?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Artificial islands just for gambling? That sounds ambitious. And, uh, isn't gambling totally illegal in Azerbaijan right now?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gambling businesses in Azerbaijan have been outlawed since 1999. All forms of gambling establishments and online gambling (including casinos, poker, and sports betting) are completely banned in the country, with the exception of state-run lotteries and sports totalizators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Yeah, that's the kicker! It has been outlawed since 1999. But, like, they're discussing amendments to the current legislation to make this possible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the kicker! It has been outlawed since nineteen ninety nine. But, like, they're discussing amendments to the current legislation to make this possible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gambling businesses in Azerbaijan have been outlawed since 1999. To make this possible, amendments to the current legislation are being considered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, a complete U-turn then. Is it just casinos, or is it, um, any kind of gambling?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, a complete U turn then. Is it just casinos, or is it, um, any kind of gambling?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The draft law says any business not prohibited by Azerbaijani law, but casinos and gambling would only be permitted in these specially designated zones. And you'd need a special license.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The draft law says any business not prohibited by Azerbaijani law, but casinos and gambling would only be permitted in these specially designated zones. And you'd need a special license.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The document states that any type of business not prohibited by Azerbaijani law may be conducted on these territories. Casinos and other forms of gambling will be permitted only in specially designated zones that meet regulatory requirements. Only companies that obtain a special license will be able to organize such gambling activities.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, a license. How much are we talking for one of those, like, casino licenses?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, a license. How much are we talking for one of those, like, casino licenses?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it's, um, quite a bit. We're looking at 340,000 manats for a one-year license. That's a hefty chunk of change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it's, um, quite a bit. We're looking at three hundred forty thousand manats for a one-year license. That's a hefty chunk of change.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The state will charge a fee of 340,000 manats (approximately 106 million tenge) for a casino license. The license will be valid for one year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: A year? And then you have to renew it for the same amount? That seems pretty steep for a new venture.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A year? And then you have to renew it for the same amount? That seems pretty steep for a new venture.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The government would be setting all the conditions and rules, so they're definitely keeping a tight rein on it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The government would be setting all the conditions and rules, so they're definitely keeping a tight rein on it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The conditions for conducting games and the licensing rules will be determined by the government.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, on the one hand, it's a huge economic opportunity, probably for tourism and revenue. But then, uh, you also have the social impact to consider.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, on the one hand, it's a huge economic opportunity, probably for tourism and revenue. But then, uh, you also have the social impact to consider.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It's a really interesting pivot for a country that's had such a strict ban for so long.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It's a really interesting pivot for a country that's had such a strict ban for so long.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It just makes you wonder, like, what's driving this sudden change of heart, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It just makes you wonder, like, what's driving this sudden change of heart, you know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, definitely one to watch. It's a bold move, that's for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, definitely one to watch. It's a bold move, that's for sure.
